content: this heel is the reverse of the fleegle heel knit cuff-down instead of toe-up the instructions are for the heel only and meant to be used with other cuff-down sock patterns **gauge** any gauge **sizes** based on the total stitch count of the sock 36 40 44 48 52 56 60 64 68 72 76 80 stitches **yarn** any yarn can be used for this pattern *sample yarn * sport weight - schoppel zauberball starke 6 75% superwash wool 25% nylon in color 2516 abendstunde **needles** any needle size to achieve a sock gauge using your chosen yarn weight *suggested needle size * fingering - us 0/2 0 mm or us 1/2 25 mm sport - us 1 5/2 5 mm or us 2/2 75 mm dk - us 3/3 25 mm or us 4/3 5 mm worsted - us 5/3 75 mm or us 6/4 0 mm **magic loop method** this pattern uses the magic loop method all instructions are based on half of the stitches being on the front needle and the other half on the back needle you can substitute another method but you ll need to keep track of the stitches as front needle stiches and back needle stitches **note ** this pattern is different from the strong heel because the heel flap/turn is at the back of the heel instead of beneath it this makes the heel taller and provides slightly more room in the instep
